result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (1/5/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.
Court orders DNA sample.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer concurrent with sentence imposed in 15CF49.

15CF49 & 15CF154: Defendant Michelle L Andrews in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead to Counts 2 & 3 in 15CF49 and Misd. BJ in 15CF154 as amended; State heard on recomm.; Def. now lives in Montana; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Misd. BJ in 15CF154, Guilty to DC in Counts 2 & 3 in 15CF49; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of DC in Counts 2 & 3 of 15CF49 w/Count 1 D&RI; Court finds Def. guilty of Misd. BJ as amended in 15CF154; State heard; Court reviews letter from victim supplied by Atty. Lutgen; Atty. Lutgen heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded to custody; costs to be paid out of cash bond held

10:29 Defendant Michelle L Andrews in court with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim  set. Court sets $1,000 cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
